title: WeWork In The Covid And Post-Covid Coworking Race
author: Bill Conerly

title: Job Habits That Shorten Your Career And Life: How Many Do You Practice?
description: Bad Health habits at work contribute to a truncated career trajectory and an early death. Finding out what they are and what you can do about them can prevent your job from terminating your career and your life.
author: Bryan Robinson

title: AI On Mars: Interview With Tom Soderstrom, Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
description: Tom Soderstrom, IT Chief Technology and Innovation Officer at NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory shares his insights into how AI is increasingly being used by remote devices in space and some insights into how AI is being applied for space and planetary exploration as well as right here on Earth.
author: Ron Schmelzer

title: How To Create The Conditions To Optimize Your Success
description: Too often the power of context is given short-shrift or ignored when it is a powerful governor of behavior. A small amount of time and effort to influence one's context can have dramatic results.
author: Constance Dierickx

title: Got Bored Kids? Here Are 20 Fun Activities For A Pandemic Summer
author: Dana Brownlee

title: Harvard Professor’s Article Makes Outrageous, Inaccurate Claim About Police Violence. There Are Zero Consequences
description: A Harvard professor recently published an article in The New Yorker about police violence that includes a claim so outrageous that it is difficult to understand how she or her editors could have believed it.
author: Evan Gerstmann

title: A Human Rights Body Calls Upon States To Take Legal Actions Against China For Its Atrocities Against Uighur Muslims
description: On July 22, 2020, the Bar Human Rights Committee, international human rights arm of the Bar of England and Wales, published a briefing paper “Responsibility of States under International Law to Uighurs and other Turkic Muslims in Xinjiang, China” mapping the avenues for legal recourse.
author: Ewelina U. Ochab

title: Hiring Managers & Diversity: How To Take The Bias Out Of Your Interviewing Process
description: Having a diverse workforce is not about hitting some magic demographic number. It’s about bringing in viewpoints and perspectives that match the global market that most companies serve today. How do you minimize or remove the bias that is present in all of us from the interviewing process?
author: H.V. MacArthur

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez: It’s Not Personal. It’s Cultural
description: Women on both sides of the aisle have been demeaned and belittled, not to mention suffered harassment and worse by male colleagues. Rep. Ocasio-Cortez said enough is enough, and in doing so, sent a clear signal to women everywhere that "boys will be boys" behavior is unacceptable.
author: John Baldoni

title: Bacardi Apologizes For Thinking Gendered Drinks Were A Good Idea
description: Who needs a reduced-calorie, reduced-alcohol spirit during a pandemic? According to Bacardi, women do. Judging from the social media response, women don't agree.
author: Kim Elsesser

title: Small Businesses Are Optimistic About The Future, Even As They Continue Navigating Covid-19
author: Samantha Todd

title: Defund Teaching About Slavery? Sen. Tom Cotton Proposes Legislation Attacking The 1619 Project
description: Senator Tom Cotton (R-AR) wants to limit public schools from using a popular journalism initiative focused on the history of American slavery. What is he trying to hide?
author: Seth Cohen

title: Trump Move Against International Students May Have Backfired
author: Stuart Anderson

title: Senate Unveils Second Stimulus Check Details Today
author: Terina Allen

title: Meet America’s Best Temporary Staffing Firms 2020
author: Vicky Valet

title: $600 A Week Unemployment Benefits End Tomorrow
description: Unless Congress acts now, the $600 a week unemployment benefits will end tomorrow.
author: Zack Friedman
